properties.name: BCAT
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  647 Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY 11217Brooklyn Community Access Television (BCAT) manages Brooklyn’s public access channels, offering viewers four cable channels of programs produced by the community for the community. The BCAT Media Center provides Brooklyn residents with a broad range of media services and support programs that enables the creation, production, and cablecasting of community television programs of Brooklynites.

properties.name: Charlottesville Public Access
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1000 East Rio Road 22901Broadcasting on Adelphia Cable Channels 13 and 14, Charlottesville Public Access TV serves the citizens of Charlottesville and Albemarle County by promoting the use of local community access channels, providing television production training, and encouraging residents to produce non-commercial programming. It is owned, managed, and operated by Adelphia Communications in conjunction with Charlottesville City Council. The Mission of CPA-TV is to enhance the unity and strength of the community by providing: A medium for community dialogue and educational and training opportunities. A source of information of local, national, and international origin. A forum for the exchange of ideas on issues and topics of community interest.

properties.name: GRTV-25 Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  711 Bridge Street NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504Most of our tools, training and transmission are headquartered at CMC Bridge Street; however, with the Mobile Media Lab, the MOLLIE capabilities and CMC Wealthy GRTV-25 is able to go just about anywhere.

properties.name: GRTV-25 Wealthy
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1130 Wealthy St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49504GRTV-25 has faciilties, equipment, and special events at our CMC Wealthy location. The storied Wealthy Street Theater is a landmark of a proud past, and the hallmark of a vibrant future in community media.

properties.name: Hartford Public Access TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  20-28 Sargeant St., Hartford, CT 06105Providing the city of Hartford’s community, government and educational institutions free and unrestricted access to the cable television system.

properties.name: Missoula public access TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  500 N Higgins Ave. 59807Missoula Community Access Television (MCAT) provides Missoula residents and organizations with the equipment, training, and channel time to produce TV programs based on their interests and concerns. These programs reflect Missoula\'s cultural, political, and intellectual diversity, and help foster a community dialogue about people and issues that might otherwise go unnoticed.

properties.name: NPAT
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1015 Seventh Street, Novato, CaliforniaNovato Public Access Television

properties.name: Nutmeg TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  58 West Main Street, Plainville, CT 06062-1904Formed in 1990, Nutmeg Public Access Television, Inc. is an independent, not for profit corporation that manages community access television (public, education and government, or P.E.G.) for eight towns in west-central Connecticut. Ordinary residents, educational institutions, and local governments from the cities and towns of Avon, Berlin, Bristol, Burlington, Canton, Farmington, New Britain, and Plainville, Connecticut are eligible to create or provide television programs that are shown on Nutmeg TV\'s three cable channels. We teach volunteers how to operate TV production equipment and create programs. Community access television is a great way to express views and learn about the people and organizations within our eight towns.

properties.name: PACT
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1143 Northwestern Ave. Austin, TX 78702-2812 Austin Public Access Television

properties.name: PATV public access
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  206 Lafayette St. 52240Public Access Television, serving the Iowa City & Coralville community for over fifteen years. PATV is Your Neighborhood Network. Our mission is to offer the public the tools, training, and assistance needed to use the medium of television as a forum for expressing the diversity of views, interests, and backgrounds in our community. You can find us on Cable Channel 18 in the Iowa City/Coralville area.

properties.name: SCAN access TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1125 North 98th Street Seattle, WA 98103"The SCAN board is committed to a strong channel, diverse programming, outreach projects, new technologies and regional inclusion. We have interesting challenges and opportunities to forge new concepts of access appropriate for the 21st century."- Ann Suter, Executive Director

properties.name: Somerville public access TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  90 Union Square 02143Somerville Community Access Television’s mission is to provide a public access media center that enables a vibrant, diverse, and evolving community to express its creativity, explain its ideas, share its cultures, and embrace the individual’s right to freedom of speech.

properties.name: TVTV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  6225 W. Overland Road 83709Treasure Valley Public Access Television. TVTV facilitates a free exchange of ideas, community dialogue and artistic expression for the citizens of the Treasure Valley. We are a volunteer-based not-for-profit Idaho corporation formed to facilitate, encourage, and promote community involvement in the production of locally-originated television, and to oversee and ensure the contractual and regulatory commitments to public, educational and governmental access of the cable communication system provider for the City of Boise.

properties.name: acessf public access TV
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1720 Market Street 94102Access San Francisco is San Francisco\'s public access television station, airing on cable channel 29, which is operated and managed by the San Francisco Community Television Corporation (SFCTC), a community-based, non-profit corporation. Our mission is to strengthen the fabric of community life by enabling open communication through public access television and other electronic media. Our programming reflects the diversity and interests of our San Francisco communities and residents.
